intro: Orchis peloria, commonly known as the fairy orchid, is a rare and striking member of the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy flowers that can range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Its unique floral structure includes a prominent lip that distinguishes it from other orchid species. Orchis peloria is notable for its historical association with folklore and its status as a protected species in many regions.
